intro: Orthophytum alvimii, commonly known as the Alvim's orchid, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its compact, pseudobulbous structure. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
